Generation III.Ruby: Silcoon tethers itself to a tree branch using silk to keep from falling. There, this Pok é mon hangs quietly while it awaits evolution. It peers out of the silk cocoon through a small hole.
Generation III.Sapphire: Silcoon was thought to endure hunger and not consume anything before its evolution. However, it is now thought that this Pok é mon slakes its thirst by drinking rainwater that collects on its silk.
Generation III.Emerald: It prepares for evolution using the energy it stored while it was a Wurmple . It keeps watch over the surroundings with its two eyes.
Generation III.FireRed: It conserves its energy by moving as little as possible. It awaits evolution while drinking only a little rainwater.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It conserves its energy by moving as little as possible. It awaits evolution while drinking only a little rainwater.

Generation IV.Diamond: It anchors itself by wrapping twigs with the silk from its body. It motionlessly awaits evolution.
Generation IV.Pearl: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.
Generation IV.Platinum: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Having wrapped silk around the branches of a tree, it quiescently awaits evolution.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Having wrapped silk around the branches of a tree, it quiescently awaits evolution.

Generation V.Black: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.
Generation V.White: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.
Generation V.Black 2: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.
Generation V.White 2: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.

Generation VI.X: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.
Generation VI.Y: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Silcoon tethers itself to a tree branch using silk to keep from falling. There, this Pokémon hangs quietly while it awaits evolution. It peers out of the silk cocoon through a small hole.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Silcoon was thought to endure hunger and not consume anything before its evolution. However, it is now thought that this Pokémon slakes its thirst by drinking rainwater that collects on its silk.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It anchors itself by wrapping twigs with the silk from its body. It motionlessly awaits evolution.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It drinks dew that collects on its silk while it waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for evolution. It can't extend its limbs and its movement is slow, but its eyes keep a sharp lookout—Silcoon is always on guard.

Generation IV.Diamond: Eterna Forest Routes 205 , 206 , 207 , 208 , 209 , 210 , 211 , 212 , 213 , 214 , 215 , 218 , 221 , 222 , Eterna Forest , Floaroma Meadow , Fuego Ironworks , Valley Windworks ( Honey Trees )

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Eterna Forest Routes 205 , 206 , 207 , 208 , 209 , 210 , 211 , 212 , 213 , 214 , 215 , 218 , 221 , 222 , Eterna Forest , Floaroma Meadow , Fuego Ironworks , Valley Windworks ( Honey Trees ) Grand Underground - Grassland Cave , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Sunlit Cavern
